page.title: 16School Camp,Mundesley,1985
page.content: half hours to get there. When we arrived all the other children were already there,but that was because we had travelled further than they had.As soon as we got off the coach we had some lunch in a huge marquee which was big enough for three hundred children.For lunch we had luncheon meat and salad. After lunch we took our things to our tents.Mr Richards had told us that the tents looked like a fat,round,ice_ cream cone turned upside down.He was right,but they were much taller than we thought they would be.They were about four metres high.All the girls on camp had to sleep in tents in one field,and all the boys in another.The six girls from our school shared a tent,but the nine boys had two tents between them.
